text:
January 23, 1956
Mr. M. S. Navik
300 West 23rd Street
Suite 1200
New York 11, New York
Lear Mauryi
Excellent article. I'd read earlier and routed around here. Guess I
neglected to say anything to you. It's now a basic document for use by
my Seminar students. Excellent job.
I too am too busy to do a decent job of writing. Been particularly
rushed with trips etc. lately. Expect to be in N. Y. Wednesday night
and Thursday a.m., in fact. Have at least three conferences, but will
call you if I have time. Staying at the Shelburne Hotel, near Air
Terminal, 303 Lexington Avenue at 37th Street.
Attached are two items. Taishoff's insistence on taking ETV frequencies
away, moved me to write the attached letter to the Editor. Suppose he'll
use it? Would like to get this point of view to readers of his magazine.
The other (the dittoed one) is one I haven't placed yet, either. If you
have any ideas, let me know.
Regards,
HJStjy
Harry J. Skomia
Executive Director
